CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 9, 1961, pg. 1 reads:"Nigerian Freed - Zacheus Okediji of Nigeria, a premedical student at Berea (Ky.) College, is shown being congratulated by defense Atty. Samuel Goldstock and some of the former's many prominent friends, who testified to Okediji's sterling character. The scene took place outside Criminal Court, Tuesday, shortly after Judge David Weiss cleared Okediji and ruled that a 15-year-old white girl, who charged him with indecent assault, suffered "pictures in head."  Shown are (left to right): Nurse Nadine Ratterman, Miss Florence Shute, retired teacher; Dr. Robert Klein (partly obscured), City Councilman James A. Jordon; Mrs. W. Lather and John C. Weaver, moderator of the Allegheny Roundtable. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Atty. Samuel Goldstock congratulating Zacheus Okediji after acquittal, with, from left: Nadine Ratterman wearing dark gloves, Florence Shute, Dr. Robert Klein partly obscured, James A. Jordon, Mrs. W. Lather, and John C. Weaver, in Allegheny County Courthouse
